Prop.Name: Generate OpenAPI interface
Prop.Description: Generate OpenAPI documentation (default.yaml) for procedures, business components and dataproviders exposed as REST web services.

Prop.Name: Generate OData interface
Prop.Description: Generate OData interface & metadata for business components and dataproviders exposed as web services.

Prop.Name: Java package name
Prop.Description: Lets the generator know in which Java package it must generate the programs

Prop.Name: User Log level
Prop.Description: Level of detail written to the Log when using the Log API programmatically.

Prop.Name: JDBC Log level
Prop.Description: It allows to create a log file per namespace, or one per each datastore or one per each connection. It is useful to make it easier to understand the execution path of an application.

Group.Name: HttpClient pool
Group.Description: The group allows you configure values related to httpClient pools management

Prop.Name: Maximum pool size
Prop.Description: Maximum number of HttpClient connections handled by the pool

Prop.Name: Maximum pool size per route
Prop.Description: Maximum number of connections per specific route

Group.Name: Storage configuration
Group.Description: Indicates what kind of service use to storage images, videos, static content, etc. Can be a local storage or a external service

Prop.Name: Storage Provider
Prop.Description: Application Storage Provider. Local or external (ie: AmazonS3, OpenStack, Bluemix or Azure)

Group.Name: Notifications configuration
Group.Description: Indicates what kind of service use to send notifications

Prop.Name: Database access caching
Prop.Description: The result set of each query to the table is stored in a storage cache, and while the cache does not expire, the cache is queried in each read operation and the database is not accessed.

Prop.Name: Hardly ever TTL(mins)
Prop.Description: Elapsed time, in minutes, that the statement cache keeps information for statements

Prop.Name: Time to Time TTL(mins)
Prop.Description: Elapsed time, in minutes, that the statement cache keeps information for statements

Prop.Name: Cache storage size
Prop.Description: Amount of memory of the server running the application within the process in execution, dedicated to storing the data cache

Prop.Name: Cache Provider
Prop.Description: Application Cache Provider. InProcess (in memory) or distributed (ie: MemCached or Redis)

Group.Name: Web Notifications configuration
Group.Description: Indicates what kind of service use to send web notifications

Prop.Name: Confirmation
Prop.Description: In transactions, it indicates whether or not the user's confirmation will be requested when passing from one level to another. In procedures, it indicates whether or not the user's confirmation will be requested when the process starts executing.

Value.desc: Do not prompt on first level

Prop.Name: First day of week
Prop.Description: Select first day of week for calendar

Value.desc: Enter, Down Arrow, Up Arrow, Tab, Shift-Tab
'+' Key, Down Arrow, Up Arrow, Tab, Shift-Tab

Prop.Name: Assign Function Keys to Standard Events

Value.desc: Error on non-standard functions when specifying

Prop.Name: Disabled warnings
Prop.Description: Type a space separated list of warning message codes you want to be disabled.

Prop.Name: Warnings treated as errors
Prop.Description: Type a space separated list of warning message codes you want to be treated as errors.

Prop.Name: Expand dynamic calls
Prop.Description: Convert dynamic calls to static calls to every possible object.

Prop.Name: Generate prompt programs
Prop.Description: Controls whether prompt objects are generated automatically or not.

Value.desc: First input att/var on the page
First input att/var on the page only if not embedded

Prop.Name: Tomcat version
Prop.Description: Sets the Tomcat version where the code will run

Prop.Name: Java platform support
Prop.Description: The server´s version to be used determines the Java Platform to choose.If you do not know which server your application will use, choose the option 'Both Platforms'

Prop.Name: Tomcat path
Prop.Description: Sets the path where Tomcat is installed

Prop.Name: Static content directory seen from client
Prop.Description: Static content directory seen from client

Prop.Name: Expose descriptive metadata
Prop.Description: Controls whether build information is exposed in the generated code files. It consists of metadata about the GeneXus environment used, such as version, database server, generation timestamp. It applies to javascript, server-side, and HTML files.

Prop.Name: Deploy To Cloud Settings Changed
Prop.Description: Used to specify if the deploy to cloud settings has changed and synchronization between GeneXus and the cloud is needed.
